newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK's inflation rate could dip further -- Tsang.
newsitem.headline: HK's inflation rate could dip further -- Tsang.

text.p: Hong Kong's Financial Secretary Donald Tsang on Sunday said inflation in the territory was under control and could fall lower for the rest of 1996.
Previous government estimates of a 7.5 percent inflation rate for 1996 might be revised downward, government radio quoted Tsang as saying.
Tsang did not say what the new estimate would be.
Hong Kong's annual consumer price inflation has kept a downward trend with a rate of 6.1 percent reported for July, versus 6.4 percent for June, the government had said.
